meanings.definition: Look at someone or something with one or both eyes partly closed in an attempt to see more clearly.
meanings.sent1: She had to squint to read the tiny print on the menu.
meanings.sent2: I squinted in the bright sunlight to see the distant mountains.
meanings.sent3: He squinted at the blurry photo, trying to make out the faces.
meanings.sent4: The detective squinted at the clue, hoping for a breakthrough.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, she squinted to catch a glimpse of the elusive comet.

meanings.definition: A condition in which the eyes are not properly aligned with each other, causing double vision.
meanings.sent1: His squint made it difficult for him to focus on objects.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed her with a slight squint in her left eye.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked about his squint, saying he had 'double the vision'.
meanings.sent4: Her squint was like having a built-in kaleidoscope in her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a portrait with a subtle squint, adding depth to the subject's gaze.
